name: ludos-kanban
description: Kanban Board that supports export to markdown / marp

markdown-kanban.pathGeneration.description: How to generate file paths when creating links from drag & drop, clipboard, and link replacement
enumDescriptions: Generate relative paths from the current document

markdown-kanban.mediaIndexScanScope.description: Where the MediaIndex scans for media files used for duplicate detection during file drops.
enumDescriptions: Only scan the Media folders for the main file and included markdown files
Scan the folders containing the main file and included markdown files (including subfolders)

markdown-kanban.dateLocale.description: Date format locale for parsing temporal tags. 'auto' detects from system locale. European locales (de-*, fr-*, en-GB) use DD.MM.YYYY format, en-US uses MM/DD/YYYY, iso uses YYYY-MM-DD.

markdown-kanban.dashboard.boards.description: List of kanban boards to include in the Dashboard panel

uri.description: File URI of the kanban board

timeframe.description: Timeframe in days for showing upcoming items

enabled.description: Whether this board is visible in the dashboard

markdown-kanban.dashboard.defaultTimefra.description: Default timeframe in days for new boards added to the Dashboard

markdown-kanban.templates.showBar.description: Show the template bar at the top of the kanban board when templates are available

markdown-kanban.templates.path.description: Path to the folder containing column templates. Each template should be in its own subfolder with a template.md file.

Overview.label: Overview
Overview.description: Compact view for seeing many cards

markdown-kanban.layoutPresets.description: Layout presets configuration. Each preset should contain a 'label', 'description', and 'settings' object with layout options. Default presets (Overview, normal, grid3x, focused) can be customized or overridden.

description.description: Description of what this preset does

markdown-kanban.columnWidth.description: Column width preference for the kanban board. Supports pixel and viewport values and retains compatibility with legacy string keys.

markdown-kanban.layoutRows.description: Number of layout rows to show in the board view.

markdown-kanban.rowHeight.description: Row height configuration used when multiple rows exist.

markdown-kanban.taskMinHeight.description: Minimum height for each task card.

markdown-kanban.sectionHeight.description: Section height configuration for the kanban board.

markdown-kanban.taskSectionHeight.description: Task section height used inside the column cards.

markdown-kanban.fontSize.description: Base font size multiplier applied on the board.

markdown-kanban.fontFamily.description: Primary font family used for the kanban board text.

markdown-kanban.layoutPreset.description: Default layout preset applied at startup.

markdown-kanban.stickyStackMode.description: Sticky stack behavior for column stacks.

markdown-kanban.tagVisibility.description: Tag visibility and filtering within the board.

markdown-kanban.exportTagVisibility.description: Include tag visibility settings when exporting.

markdown-kanban.htmlCommentRenderMode.description: How HTML comments should render inside tasks.

markdown-kanban.htmlContentRenderMode.description: How HTML content within the board should render.

markdown-kanban.embed.knownDomains.description: URL patterns for auto-detecting embed URLs. Supports wildcards (*). URLs matching these patterns will be rendered as iframes.

default.allow: fullscreen; clipboard-read; clipboard-write; autoplay; encrypted-media; picture-in-picture

markdown-kanban.embed.defaultIframeAttri.description: Default attributes for rendered iframe embeds. Can be overridden per-embed using {key=value} syntax.

markdown-kanban.embed.exportHandling.description: How to handle embeds when exporting to PDF. 'url' shows a styled link, 'fallback' uses the fallback image if specified, 'remove' strips embeds entirely.
enumDescriptions: Show a styled URL link box in place of the embed
Use the fallback image specified in alt text (falls back to URL if no image)
Remove embeds entirely from the export

markdown-kanban.openLinksInNewTab.description: Open extracted links in a new tab when activated.

markdown-kanban.showMarpSettings.description: Toggle visibility of Marp-specific controls in the kanban view.

markdown-kanban.showSpecialCharacters.description: Show visual markers for whitespace characters inside cards.

markdown-kanban.wysiwygEnabled.description: Enable the WYSIWYG editor for task descriptions.

markdown-kanban.overlayEditorEnabled.description: Enable the overlay task editor as the default editing experience.

markdown-kanban.overlayEditorDefaultMode.description: Default mode used when opening the overlay task editor.

markdown-kanban.overlayEditorFontScale.description: Font scale multiplier applied inside the overlay task editor.

markdown-kanban.tagColors.description: Grouped color and style configuration for tags in kanban boards with various visual indicators.

markdown-kanban.enabledTagCategoriesColu.markdownDescription:
**Column Tag Categories** - Select which categories appear in column burger menus. All 26 categories available. See 'Tag Category Reference' above for details.

**Column Defaults (4):** Workflow, Positivity, Colors, Complexity

markdown-kanban.enabledTagCategoriesTask.markdownDescription:
**Task Tag Categories** - Select which categories appear in task burger menus. All 26 categories available. See 'Tag Category Reference' above for details.

**Task Defaults (4):** Positivity, Status, Colors, Impact

markdown-kanban.customTagCategories.description: Define custom tag categories. Each Category should map Category name to tag configurations. Example: {"myCategory": {"myTag": {"border": {"color": "#FF0000", "width": "2px", "style": "solid", "position": "full"}}}}

additionalProperties.description: Custom tag Category containing tag definitions
Tag configuration with styling properties (border, headerBar, footerBar, cornerBadge, light, dark, etc.)

markdown-kanban.tagCategoryReference.markdownDescription:
## Tag Category Reference

All 26 tag categories available for both columns and tasks. Each Category uses consistent styling:

### Column-Optimized Categories (headerBar + border)
- `Workflow` - Workflow stages: ideas, outline, draft, review, polish, ready, published, active, testing, production, archive
- `Organization` - Organization: intro, core, advanced, frontend, backend, infrastructure, design
- `Teaching-Content` - Teaching content: slide, video, reading, exercise, quiz, demo, interactive, handout, discussion  
- `Product-Content` - Product content: story, task, chore, improvement, design, infrastructure-task
- `Complexity` - Complexity levels: trivial, beginner, intermediate, advanced-level, expert
- `Schedule` - Schedule phases: Schedule, planning, preparation, verify
- `Overview` - Overview content: Overview, information, presentation
- `Example` - Example content: Example, tasks, homework
- `Deliveries` - Deliverables: Deliveries, handouts, references

### Task-Optimized Categories (cornerBadge + background)
- `Priority` - Priority levels: urgent, high, medium, low, delayed, stopped
- `Positivity` - Sentiment levels: ++ (very positive), + (positive), Ã¸ (neutral), - (negative), -- (very negative)
- `Status` - Status states: todo, inprogress, done, blocked, testing, wip, cancelled, archived
- `Status-Review` - Review states: needs-review, in-review, needs-changes, reviewed, needs-approval, approved, rejected
- `Time-Estimate` - Time estimates: quick, medium-time, long
- `Status-Testing` - Testing states: untested, unit-tested, integration-tested, e2e-tested, security-tested, performance-tested, regression-tested, uat-passed
- `Teaching-Platform` - Teaching platforms: online, in-person, hybrid, async, sync
- `Product-Platform` - Product platforms: web, mobile, ios, android, desktop, api
- `version` - Version tags: v1, v2, v3, rc, stable, legacy, eol
- `Impact` - Impact levels: minor, moderate, major, breaking

### Universal Categories (work on both)
- `Importance` - Importance: critical, normal
- `type` - Item types: bug, feature, enhancement, documentation, epic, spike, refactor
- `Category` - Technical areas: backend, frontend, database, api, security, performance, ux, ui

### Color Categories (background only)
- `Colors-Dark` - 12 dark Colors: dark-red, dark-orange, dark-yellow, dark-green, dark-cyan, dark-blue, dark-purple, dark-pink, dark-brown, dark-gray, black, dark-charcoal
- `Colors` - 12 normal Colors: red, orange, yellow, green, cyan, blue, purple, pink, brown, gray, teal, indigo
- `Colors-Light` - 12 light Colors: light-red, light-orange, light-yellow, light-green, light-cyan, light-blue, light-purple, light-pink, light-brown, light-gray, white, light-beige
- `Colors-Accessible` - 8 WCAG Colors: accessible-indigo (#332288), accessible-green (#117733), accessible-teal (#44AA99), accessible-cyan (#88CCEE), accessible-yellow (#DDCC77), accessible-rose (#CC6677), accessible-purple (#AA4499), accessible-magenta (#882255)

markdown-kanban.maxRowHeight.description: Maximum height for kanban rows in pixels. Set to 0 for unlimited height (full card height). Other values limit the row height.

markdown-kanban.arrowKeyFocusScroll.description: How arrow key navigation scrolls focused items into view
enumDescriptions: Center the focused item in the viewport
Scroll just enough to bring the item into view

markdown-kanban.columnBorder.description: Complete border style for columns (e.g., '1px solid var(--vscode-panel-border)', '1px dashed red', 'none'). Full CSS border shorthand supported.

markdown-kanban.taskBorder.description: Complete border style for task cards (e.g., '1px solid var(--vscode-panel-border)', '2px dotted blue', 'none'). Full CSS border shorthand supported.

markdown-kanban.enableBackups.description: Enable automatic backups of kanban files

markdown-kanban.backupInterval.description: Interval in minutes between automatic backups (1-60 minutes)

enumDescriptions: Store backups in the same folder as the original file
Store backups in a .backups folder in the workspace root
Store backups in a custom location (set customBackupPath)

markdown-kanban.maxBackupsPerFile.description: Maximum number of backups to keep per file (older backups will be deleted)

markdown-kanban.popplerPath.description: Path to poppler tools directory (containing pdftoppm and pdfinfo). Leave empty for auto-detection. Example: /opt/homebrew/bin

markdown-kanban.mutoolPath.description: Path to MuPDF tools directory (containing mutool for EPUB rendering). Leave empty for auto-detection. Example: /opt/homebrew/bin

markdown-kanban.drawioPath.description: Path to draw.io CLI executable. Leave empty for auto-detection. Example: /opt/homebrew/bin/drawio

markdown-kanban.graphvizPath.description: Path to Graphviz dot executable (used by PlantUML). Leave empty for auto-detection. Example: /opt/homebrew/bin/dot

markdown-kanban.javaPath.description: Path to Java executable (used by PlantUML). Leave empty for auto-detection. Example: /usr/bin/java

markdown-kanban.pandoc.path.description: Custom path to Pandoc binary. Leave empty to use system PATH. Install Pandoc from https://pandoc.org/installing.html

markdown-kanban.marp.enginePath.description: Path to the Marp engine JavaScript file

markdown-kanban.marp.defaultTheme.description: Default theme to use for Marp presentations

markdown-kanban.marp.allowLocalFiles.description: Allow Marp to access local files (images, etc.)

markdown-kanban.marp.keepTempFiles.description: Keep temporary files created during Marp exports instead of deleting them immediately.

markdown-kanban.marp.browser.description: Browser to use for Marp preview

markdown-kanban.marp.themeFolders.description: Additional theme folders for Marp. Add paths to directories containing custom Marp theme CSS files. Paths can be relative to workspace or absolute.

items.description: Path to a directory containing Marp theme CSS files

markdown-kanban.marp.availableClasses.description: Available CSS class names that can be used in Marp presentations. These are applied using <!-- class: ... --> directives. Add custom classes here to extend with your own theme styles.

markdown-kanban.marp.commonColors.description: Common color values for color and backgroundColor directives

markdown-kanban.marp.globalClasses.description: Global CSS classes to apply to all slides in exported Marp presentations. Uses global directive syntax (class: ...). Example: ['font24', 'center']

markdown-kanban.marp.localClasses.description: Local CSS classes to apply only to specific slides (per-column or per-task). Uses scoped directive syntax (_class: ...). Configure per-export or via task metadata.

markdown-kanban.sidebar.autoScan.description: Automatically scan workspace for kanban boards on first activation

scripts.compile: npm run check-types && npm run lint && npm run sync-marp-engine && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run check-types && npm run lint && npm run sync-marp-engine && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
